Description: Prostate cancer is a commonly diagnosed and deadly cancer in men, with a recently reported increase in cases. Metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer (mCRPC), an advanced form of prostate cancer, has particularly dismal outcomes and limited treatment options. However, a growing pathophysiological understanding of disease, coupled with robust drug development over the last decade, have led to recent drug approvals that are rapidly revolutionizing the treatment paradigm for mCRPC. This symposium will review emerging research in mCRPC, with a focus on the role of prostate cancer signaling pathways and how they relate to current therapeutic trends and new therapeutic targets.
SearchResultBody: ESP01A. Connecting Mechanism of Disease to Clinical Advances in Metastatic Prostate Cancer
Title: Connecting Mechanism of Disease to Clinical Advances in Metastatic Prostate Cancer
